# BlockQuote

> Line 1
> Line 2
> Line 3
>
> Line 5

> This paragraph is long enough that it will not fit on a single line. It really is that long. Long enough in fact to demonstrate that even if the content wraps across multiple lines in the editor, the result should be that the resulting output from this is all still a block quote.  Only if you have a hard line break will you require the use of an angle bracket to once again instigate the block quote syntax. Just to make sure this line really is long enough, why not try some Pi - 3.


> Base level of block quote.
>
> > Now quoting within a quote
>
> Back to the base level.

    His beak can hold more than his belican.
    Food for a week
    He can hold in his beak,
    But I don't know how the helican.

    Who said, 'It is just as I feared!
    Two Owls and a Hen,
    Four Larks and a Wren,
    Have all built their nests in my beard!

# Hyperlink

Did you know that [the Drafts web site is at getdrafts.com](https://getdrafts.com).

This would be [a relative link](/relative_page.html).

This is [Drafts example][id] reference-style link.

You could also include a space between the two like this: [Another Drafts example] [id].

[id]: https://getdrafts.com/  "Drafts Web Site"

Another link approach is this: [Drafts][]

[Drafts]: https://getdrafts.com/

<https://getdrafts.com/>

<someone@some_made-up_domain.com>

	<tbody>
		 <tr>

		</tr>
	</tbody>
